intro: Pimelea cracens subsp. cracens, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Riceflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
